Title: ADJUST
PenBody: (You can feel the pen bleeding ink into your pocket)

Start.Body: You awake in a room, your eyes adjusting to the dim lighting.

Start Room.Body: The room before you has two doors, one with a handle on the far side, and one with a slowly-blinking red light next to it on the right hand wall.

Choices.Text: Approach the heavy door now humming.

Exit (Closed).Body: The door is cold to the touch, the red blinking light providing no answers as to how to open it.

Choices.Text: Back to the rest of the room.

Exit (Open).Body: As you approach the door, power lowly humming through its frame, it slides open.

Room 1.Body:
The door leads to a new room, with a door on the far wall and one to the left of you, with electric

hazard warnings providing a sense of foreboding.

Choices.Text: The door on the far wall.

Puzzle Room (Unsolved).Body: A room with plugs lining the wall to your right and cables dangling from the wall to your left.

Puzzle Room (Solved).Body: A room with electrical connections now made.

Room 2.Body:
The door leads to a new room, with a collapsed wall in front of you and one door to the right of you, with a sign

that states "Written Records".

Written Records.Body: File cabinets line a cramped room, with some having papers overflowing out of the seams.

Choices.Text: How about the cabinets on the left?
Or maybe the ones on the right?
The ones in the middle perhaps?

Left File Cabinets.Body:
You take a slip of paper peeking out of a locked file cabinet. From the legible words, it reads,

		"...facilities across the globe are going dark, and no one on local channels are responding to our messages..."

Right File Cabinets.Body:
Sticky notes strewn across the cabinets have plans of needing to preserve electronic information in physical formats,

utilizing retro hardware that can utilize those physical formats, and other plans. Not like they matter for this long dead facility.

Middle File Cabinets.Body: The cabinets in front of you are uncharacteristically orderly when compared to the others. You attempt to open them, but they refuse to budge, the locks somehow not buckling under their rust. However, you do find and pocket a pen.

Choices.Text: Maybe you'll have better luck elsewhere.

The End.Body: The light from outside burns your eyes, yet the calm whistling of trees calms your nerves as your eyes slowly adjust to the sights around you. THE END.
